info.description: Industry-specific business data API. Verified. Affordable.
info.title: IndustryDB API

get.description: Returns critical severity audit logs (account deletions, data exports, suspicious activity). Requires admin role.
Returns recent audit logs across all users. Requires admin role.

post.description: Manually trigger a database backup (admin only)

get.description: Get list of all database backups in S3 (admin only)

post.description: Restore database from a specific backup in S3 (admin only, use with extreme caution)

parameters.description: S3 key of backup to restore
parameters.name: body

post.description: Bulk import leads from CSV file (admin only) - max 10k rows per upload
Detects industries with low data and automatically triggers data fetches to populate them. Optionally includes missing combinations. Requires admin role.

202.description: Auto-population triggered with pairs and configuration

post.description: Detects industry-country combinations with fewer leads than the specified threshold. Requires admin role.

200.description: Low data industry-country pairs with threshold and count

post.description: Detects industry-country combinations that have no data at all. Requires admin role.

get.description: Returns statistics about data population across industries and countries. Requires admin role.

post.description: Triggers data acquisition for multiple industry-country pairs concurrently. Requires admin role.

parameters.description: Batch fetch configuration with pairs, limit, and concurrency
parameters.name: request

202.description: Batch fetch triggered with count and configuration

post.description: Triggers a manual data acquisition fetch for a specific industry and country from OpenStreetMap. Requires admin role.

get.description: Get aggregated statistics about users, subscriptions, and exports (admin only)
Get paginated list of users with optional filters (admin only)

parameters.description: Filter by subscription tier (free, starter, pro, business)
parameters.name: tier

parameters.description: Filter by user role (user, admin, superadmin)
parameters.name: role

get.description: Get detailed information about a specific user including subscriptions, exports, and recent audit logs (admin only)

delete.description: Suspend (soft delete) a user account - cannot suspend yourself or superadmins (admin only)

400.description: Cannot suspend own account or superadmin

patch.description: Update user subscription tier, role, email verification status, or usage limit (admin only)

get.description: List all API keys for the authenticated user. Key hashes are not returned.

200.description: List of API keys with total count

post.description: Create a new API key for programmatic access. Requires Business tier subscription. The plain key is only shown once on creation.

201.description: API key created with plain key (shown only once)

get.description: Get aggregated usage statistics across all API keys for the authenticated user
Get details of a specific API key by ID. The key hash is not returned.

delete.description: Permanently delete an API key (hard delete). This action cannot be undone.

patch.description: Update the display name of an existing API key

post.description: Revoke an API key (soft delete). The key can no longer be used for authentication but the record is preserved.

get.description: Get list of user cohorts grouped by time period
Get activity metrics for a specific cohort
Compare retention across multiple cohorts
Get retention data for a specific cohort over time
Get detailed breakdown of funnel stages with user counts and conversion rates

parameters.description: Number of days to analyze (default: 30, max: 365)
parameters.name: days

get.description: Analyze where users drop off in the conversion funnel

parameters.description: Number of days to analyze (default: 30, max: 365)
parameters.name: days

get.description: Get conversion rates through signup  search  export  upgrade funnel

parameters.description: Number of days to analyze (default: 30, max: 365)
parameters.name: days

get.description: Get metrics on how long users take to convert between funnel stages

parameters.description: Number of days to analyze (default: 30, max: 365)
parameters.name: days

get.description: Get forecasted revenue for the next 12 months with monthly breakdown
Get current monthly recurring revenue breakdown by subscription tier
get.summary: Get revenue breakdown by subscription tier

get.description: Get average monthly growth rate over the last N months

parameters.description: Number of months to analyze (default: 3, max: 12)
parameters.name: months

get.description: Get forecasted revenue for the next N months based on historical data

parameters.description: Number of months to forecast (default: 12, max: 24)
parameters.name: months

get.description: Get all email sequences created by the user

post.description: Create a new email drip campaign sequence
Enroll a lead in an email drip campaign sequence

get.description: Get details of a lead's enrollment in a sequence

post.description: Stop a lead's enrollment in an email sequence (no more emails will be sent)
Add a new email step to a sequence

get.description: Get details of a specific email sequence step
Get details of an email sequence with its steps

put.description: Update name, description, or status of an email sequence

delete.description: Delete an email sequence and all its steps

get.description: Get statistics about lead enrichment status

post.description: Create a new note/comment on a lead
post.summary: Create a new note on a lead

get.description: Get a note by ID

delete.description: Delete a note (only owner can delete)

patch.description: Update a note's content or pinned status (only owner can update)

post.description: Enrich multiple leads in bulk

get.description: Get all leads with a specific lifecycle status
Get leads with quality scores below threshold (need improvement)
Get distribution of quality scores across all leads
Get count of leads in each lifecycle status
Get leads sorted by quality score (highest first)

post.description: Assign a lead to a specific user with a reason

get.description: Get complete assignment history for a lead

post.description: Automatically assign lead to user with fewest active leads

get.description: Get the current active assignment for a lead
Retrieve all user-defined custom fields for a specific lead
get.summary: Get all custom fields for a lead

put.description: Replace all custom fields for a lead with new values

delete.description: Remove all custom fields from a lead

post.description: Set or update a single custom field for a lead

delete.description: Remove a specific custom field from a lead

post.description: Enrich a lead with additional company data from third-party APIs

get.description: Get all email sequence enrollments for a specific lead
Calculate quality score for a lead based on data completeness

post.description: Calculate and save quality score for a lead

patch.description: Update the lifecycle status of a lead (new  contacted  qualified  negotiating  won/lost/archived)

get.description: Get complete history of status changes for a lead
Validate a lead's email address using third-party API
Get all notes for a specific lead, ordered by pinned first then by date
get.summary: List all notes for a lead

post.description: Validate up to 100 phone numbers in a single request
Convert a phone number to E.164 international format (+15551234567)
post.summary: Normalize a phone number to E.164 format

post.description: Validate and normalize a phone number with international format support

get.description: Get the user's referral code for sharing (auto-generates if none exists)
Get a list of all referrals sent by the user
Get statistics about user's referrals and rewards
Check if a referral code is valid and not expired
Get list of territories with optional filters

post.description: Create a new sales territory with geographic and industry filters

get.description: Get details of a specific territory
Get all members of a territory

post.description: Add a user as a member of a territory

delete.description: Remove a user from a territory

get.description: Get all active leads assigned to the current user
Get all territories a user belongs to

post.description: Authenticate user with email and password, returns JWT token

get.description: Processes OAuth callback and creates/logs in user

302.description: Redirect to frontend with JWT token

get.description: Redirects to OAuth provider for authentication

post.description: Create a new user account with email and password
Assertion Consumer Service endpoint. Receives and validates SAML assertions from the Identity Provider, creates or links user accounts, and issues JWT tokens.

302.description: Redirect to frontend with JWT token

get.description: Initiates the SAML 2.0 authentication flow by redirecting the user to the organization's Identity Provider

400.description: Invalid organization ID or SAML not configured

get.description: Returns the SAML 2.0 Service Provider metadata XML for the specified organization. Used by Identity Providers to configure SSO.

400.description: Invalid organization ID or SAML not configured

post.description: Execute multiple operations in a single request with transaction support
Enrich multiple leads with additional data
Create multiple webhooks in a single request
Delete multiple webhooks in a single request
Create a new Stripe checkout session to upgrade/downgrade subscription tier
Create a session to access Stripe customer portal for managing subscriptions, payment methods, and billing history

parameters.description: URL to return to after portal session (validated against whitelist)
parameters.name: return_url

get.description: Get all available subscription tiers with pricing, features, and limits
Get paginated list of all exports created by the current user

post.description: Create a new data export in CSV or Excel format with optional filters

get.description: Get detailed information about a specific export including status and download URL
Download the generated CSV or Excel file for a specific export

404.description: Export not found or file unavailable

get.description: Returns all active industries grouped by category (e.g., Personal Care, Health & Fitness, Food & Beverage)

200.description: Industries grouped by category with total count

get.description: Returns only industries that have leads in the database, with lead counts. Optionally filtered by country and city.

parameters.description: Country code to filter (e.g., US, CO, DE)
parameters.name: country

parameters.description: City name to filter (e.g., Bogota, New York)
parameters.name: city

200.description: Industries with lead counts and applied filters

get.description: Returns detailed information about a specific industry including OSM tags, category, and sort order
Returns all sub-niches for an industry with lead counts (e.g., cuisine types for restaurants, tattoo styles for tattoo studios)

200.description: Sub-niches with counts and industry metadata

get.description: Search leads with filters (industry, location, contact info). Requires authentication.
Returns a sorted, deduplicated list of cities with lead data. Optionally filtered by country. City names are normalized (accents removed, title-cased).

parameters.description: Country code to filter cities (e.g., US, GB, DE)
parameters.name: country

200.description: List of cities with total count and applied country filter

get.description: Returns a sorted list of unique countries that have lead data in the database

200.description: List of countries with total count

get.description: Get estimated count and statistics for a search without spending credits. Useful for seeing data availability before performing an actual search.
get.summary: Preview search results without charging credits

get.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific lead. Requires authentication.
List all organizations the authenticated user belongs to

200.description: List of organizations with total count

post.description: Create a new organization. The authenticated user becomes the owner.

get.description: Get details of a specific organization. Requires membership in the organization.

delete.description: Permanently delete an organization and all its members. Requires owner role.

patch.description: Update organization name or slug. Requires owner or admin role in the organization.

post.description: Invite a user to join the organization by email. Requires owner or admin role.

parameters.description: Invitation details with email and role
parameters.name: request

get.description: List all members of an organization with their roles. Requires membership in the organization.

200.description: List of members with total count

delete.description: Remove a member from the organization. Cannot remove the owner. Requires owner or admin role.

parameters.description: User ID of the member to remove
parameters.name: user_id

patch.description: Update a member's role in the organization. Cannot change the owner's role. Requires owner or admin role.

get.description: List all saved searches for the authenticated user

200.description: List of saved searches with count

post.description: Save a search query with filters for quick access. Name must be unique per user.

409.description: Saved search with this name already exists

get.description: Get details of a specific saved search by ID

patch.description: Update the name and/or filters of an existing saved search

409.description: Saved search with this name already exists

get.description: Returns usage breakdown by action type (search, export, view) for the authenticated user
get.summary: Get usage breakdown by action type

get.description: Returns daily usage statistics for the authenticated user over a configurable number of days

200.description: Daily usage data with day count

get.description: Returns aggregated usage statistics for the authenticated user over a configurable number of days
Returns audit logs for the authenticated user, ordered by most recent first

post.description: Mark the user's onboarding wizard as completed
Reset the user's onboarding wizard so they can go through it again
Process Stripe webhook events for subscription updates, payment confirmations, and cancellations

get.description: Get all webhooks for the authenticated user

post.description: Create a new webhook subscription

get.description: Get a specific webhook by ID

forecasted_arr.description: Forecasted ARR for end of year

activity_rate.description: Percentage of cohort that was active

active_users.description: Number of users active in this period

period_number.description: 0 for signup period, 1 for first retention period, etc.

retention_rate.description: Percentage of original cohort still active

The values are being populated by the APIKeyQuery when eager-loading is set.

revoked.description: Whether the key has been revoked

The values are being populated by the EmailCampaignQuery when eager-loading is set.

scheduled_at.description: When to send campaign (for scheduled campaigns)

The values are being populated by the EmailCampaignRecipientQuery when eager-loading is set.

sent_at.description: When email was sent to this recipient

description.description: Description of what this sequence does

edges.description:
Edges holds the relations/edges for other nodes in the graph.
The values are being populated by the EmailSequenceQuery when eager-loading is set.

trigger.description: What triggers enrollment in this sequence

created_by.description: CreatedBy holds the value of the created_by edge.

current_step.description: Current step number in the sequence (0 = not started)

edges.description:
Edges holds the relations/edges for other nodes in the graph.
The values are being populated by the EmailSequenceEnrollmentQuery when eager-loading is set.

sequence_id.description: Sequence the lead is enrolled in

enrolled_by.description: EnrolledBy holds the value of the enrolled_by edge.

lead.description: Lead holds the value of the lead edge.

sequence.description: Sequence holds the value of the sequence edge.

clicked_at.description: When a link in the email was clicked (if tracked)

edges.description:
Edges holds the relations/edges for other nodes in the graph.
The values are being populated by the EmailSequenceSendQuery when eager-loading is set.

opened_at.description: When the email was opened (if tracked)

scheduled_for.description: When this email is scheduled to be sent

sent_at.description: When the email was actually sent

step_id.description: Sequence step this send is for

enrollment.description: Enrollment holds the value of the enrollment edge.

lead.description: Lead holds the value of the lead edge.

step.description: Step holds the value of the step edge.

edges.description:
Edges holds the relations/edges for other nodes in the graph.
The values are being populated by the EmailSequenceStepQuery when eager-loading is set.

step_order.description: Order of this step in the sequence (1, 2, 3...)

sequence.description: Sequence holds the value of the sequence edge.

edges.description:
Edges holds the relations/edges for other nodes in the graph.
The values are being populated by the ExperimentQuery when eager-loading is set.

key.description: Unique key for referencing experiment in code

min_sample_size.description: Minimum users per variant before analysis

target_metric.description: Primary metric to measure (e.g., conversion_rate, revenue)

variants.description: List of variant names (e.g., [control, variant_a, variant_b])

edges.description:
Edges holds the relations/edges for other nodes in the graph.
The values are being populated by the ExperimentAssignmentQuery when eager-loading is set.

exposed.description: Whether user has been exposed to variant

metric_value.description: Numeric value for target metric (e.g., revenue amount)

The values are being populated by the ExportQuery when eager-loading is set.

organization_id.description: Organization ID if export belongs to organization

cuisine_type.description: For restaurants: cuisine type from OSM cuisine= tag

edges.description:

The values are being populated by the LeadQuery when eager-loading is set.

email_validated.description: Whether the email has been validated

is_enriched.description: Whether the lead has been enriched

social_media.description: Social media links (facebook, instagram, twitter, etc.)

sport_type.description: For gyms: sport/fitness type from OSM sport= tag

status_changed_at.description: When the status was last changed

sub_niche.description: Sub-category within industry (e.g., italian, crossfit, watercolor)

tattoo_style.description: For tattoos: style type (traditional, japanese, watercolor)

verified.description: Whether the lead has been verified

assigned_by_user_id.description: ID of the user who made the assignment (null for automatic assignments)

assignment_type.description: Whether the assignment was automatic or manual
